title: The Best of Shelley Fabares MP3 320
description:
The Best of Shelley Fabares

Ripped with dBpoweramp at 320

Shelley Fabares never planned to be a singer, but in 1958, while cast as Mary Stone on The Donna Reed Show, the producers wanted to take advantage of the youth market by having her cut a demo record with TV brother Paul Petersen.  When Colpix's New York head Paul Wexler heard the demos he said they were the worst he'd ever heard and flat refused to waste any money on the duo.  Tony Owen, Donna Reed's husband and producer of the show, put up the money himself to produce Shelly Fabares's first recordings.  "Johnny Angel" went straight to #21 in 1962 and follow-up "Johnny Loves Me" made #21 in the same year.

Track List:

   1. Johnny Angel
   2. What Did They Do Before Rock & Roll
   3. Johnny Loves Me
   4. I'm Growing Up
   5. Welcome Home
   6. Big Star
   7. The Things We Did Last Summer
   8. I Left a Note to Say Goodbye
   9. Telephone (Won't You Ring)
  10. Billy Boy
  11. Ronnie, Call Me When you Get a Chance
  12. How Lovely To Be a Woman
  13. Bye Bye Birdie
  14. Football Seasons Over
  15. He Don't Love Me
  16. I Know You'll Be There
  17. Lost Summer Love
  18. Pretty Please

Enjoy!
